name: malesherbez
text: Mr. Bear really is a dick in this one

name: howard
text: Nah dude. He just layin it down straight.

name: timasi
text: Think of how you would react if you had a friend inches from suicide and someone suggests wearing a magical incan gold necklace to make him happy. Riiiiight.

name: betwixt
text: he is. if you believe in the magic of the volvo of despair why shouldn't you believe in chochacho?

name: riazm
text:
Same reason it's easier to believe in Hell than Heaven.

Experience

name: zeal
text: That and, well, look at the source.  What's more likely?  That Ray happened to have a holy relic of the Incan Fun God, or that Ray's talking out of his ass/been seriously misled about his necklace's origins?

name: evilbobikus
text: More people need friends like Mr. Bear, always willing to give it to you straight, slicing through all 48 brands of bullshit you are trying to throw at them.

name: eviljoe
text: Mr. Bear is just speaking in the heat of a moment.

name: theunity
text: Beginnings of the Chochacho!

name: lizjones
text: There appear to be anger lines emanating from Mr. Bear in several panels.

name: aelindil
text: He is positively vibrating with annoyance.

name: carlyle
text: He is poistively vibrating

name: sargasm
text: Ketel One is a Dutch vodka.  Ray loves Ketel One.

name: randyjohnson
text: we (the dutch) would pronounche it kay-till (ketel)

name: spinynorman
text:
It also claims to be jenever, I think.

This cannot be. Every Dutch person I've ever seen (2) drink Ketel One has been surprised that it did not taste like "totayl shit, man". My guess is jenever is something way, way more different.

name: saru
text:
Jenever was sort of the precursor to Gin. It's more strongly flavored though. I don't remember the exact difference.
But the Ketel One people make Vodka, Citroen Vodka, and Jenever. Three separate products.

name: njury
text:
I'm dutch and the first time I drank gin was on a party when I was already oretty wasted. I filled half a cup and tasted. It was the most disgustin shit I ever drank. So naturally I ad-fundumed the rest. Jenever tastes totally different in my experience, for instance, it doesn't taste like shit.

But I'm more of a whisky man really.

name: pogo
text: A comment left by pogo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by meddle, apocowarg, Mangtastic, Satyr)

name: spoon
text: Pfff ...the dutch.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Someone lamed this lovely Metalocalypse reference because they are lame.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Yas, is totally dildoes.

name: mat4900
text: I think Cornelius is just agitated at all those comments Ray and Beef said while in the Volvo of Despair together...

name: darkwaffle
text: Achewood teaches me new words.

name: tristanhw
text: I love how cynical cornelius is here. Hes totally a dick.

name: rad-chillies
text: of course mr. bear's suit is out for alterations

name: pogo
text: His black suit -- the one ehwoudl wear to Beef's funeral.

name: aaron_haynes
text: I would like to see more of King Chochacho.

name: scriblerus
text: Panel 4: Ray is getting his P G Wodehouse on!

name: ttagxamm
text: Ray is sort of the knucklehead Bertie Wooster of the strip, isn't he?  So rich and such a fool.  Lacks only Bertie's knack for falling in and out of love and his pair of controlling aunts, really.

name: scriblerus
text:
Damn you're right.

And now, trying to imagine other intersections of Achewood and the Woosterverse is hurting my brains. Beef == Gussie Fink-Nottle? No; unfair to Beef.

name: professoryes
text: I'll agree with that. Besides, Gussie didn't have close to Circumstances.

name: laserblade
text: Actually, in the blog, some of Ray's romantic misadventures definitely evoke Bertie's.

name: deusoma
text: The interesting thing is, this is probably the longest Ray has gone without smiling in years. Looks like he's not bullshitting.

name: dasilodavi
text: The idea of this necklace has always bothered me.  It's just a damn literary device to put a final nail into this storyline.  Cornelius makes it worthwhile though.

name: vincentkv
text: How come those shoes were able to make Ray cry!?

name: slalvation
text: they were very upsetting shoes.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: Oops!

name: i_love_kate
text: Philippe feels that inadvertantly not writing a haiku merits an "Oops!"

name: direhaggis
text: It bears repeating, and often: "That's all completely stupid, but what does it have to do with anything?"

name: pogo
text: It should be above the entrance to the Ass-etbar underworld we inhabit.

name: quantumcasaba
text: I really like the phrase 'Cracker-Jack folderol.'

name: puguglypress
text:
AT LAST, THE MYSTERY OF RAY'S POSITIVITY IS SOLVED

this seems like a big deal

name: surelysmack
text: And although I do believe in the necklace, you do have to give Cornelius's account a lot of credit. Ray's positivity is over-determined.

name: hollygolightly
text:
I never knew how to spell "folderol" before now.

(# of things I've learned from Achewood: 7)

name: srikamaraja
text:
Strangely enough, things REALLY get to me when my brain is suspended in Dutch ethanol.

I have been using Mr. Bear's line in the real life for awhile now.
